fields.name: Holy Boulders- Protect What's Holy
fields.author: Access Fund
fields.description: Access Fund purchases Holy Boulders in Southern Illinois but asks the climbing community to help raise $185,000 to put this gem of the American bouldering community in climber-friendly hands forever. Protect What's Holy at www.accessfund.org/holyboulders.

fields.name: The Holy Boulders in Southern Illinois
fields.author: Jon Glassberg
fields.description: Jon Glassberg, Nate Draughn, and Brion Voges bouldering at the Holy Boulders in Southern Illinois.  Brion Voges climbing Shadow of a Man (V5), Nate Draughn climbing Jungle Book (V8) and Jon Glassberg climbing The New Zero (V13).

fields.name: Holy Boulders First Ascents and Revivals Part 1
fields.author: Kevin Sierzega
fields.description:
Since the purchase of the Holy Boulders by the Access Fund in summer of 2012, the climbing community has developed and revitalized a ton of problems at the site.  Enjoy Part 1 of this video series that encompasses over 20 new and/or revived problems, mostly in the easy to moderate grades, at this immaculate sandstone boulder field in beautiful southern Illinois! 

The ICA has been instrumental in stewarding the Holy Boulders property by directly fundraising for the acquistion, sponsoring numerous trail days, and providing local representation.  Help support Illinois climbing by becoming a member of the Illinois Climbers Association at:
www.ilclimbers.org
and on Facebook at:
https://www.facebook.com/illinoisclimbersassociation

Please follow the link below to donate and ensure the protection of the Holy Boulders for years to come:
www.accessfund.org/holyboulders

Music:
"Meet me at the Pomegranate Tree" by Quantic
"Someone Great" by LCD Soundsystem
"This Time (I'm Gonna Try it My Way)" by DJ Shadow

fields.description:
I spent a few days climbing in Southern Illinois at the Holy Boulders, here are a few highlights.

Cross and Toss V4
Enlightenment V4
Atlas V5/4?
Tyler Durden V5

fields.name: Holy Boulders, The Sequel
fields.author: Julien Gasc
fields.description: More memories from the Holy Boulders, Illinois, USA. Filmed in 02/2015. A few classics like Red Sea, Shadow of a Man, Bubble wrap, plus a traverse I don't know the name of and the first ascent of a fun little problem that I like to call Half-wheel, in remembrance of a 20 Lb piece of cheese purchased in Chicago.

fields.name: The Second Annual Holy Boulders Competition:  The Second Testament
fields.author: Kevin Sierzega
fields.description:
In 2012, the private property that housed the Holy Boulders went up for sale.  The Access Fund in collaboration with the Illinois Climbers Association immediately came forth to purchase the property.  Now, we must raise $185,000 to pay back the Access Fund and ensure that the Holy Boulders remain in climber friendly hands.
The ICA has been instrumental in fundraising for the Holy Boulders campaign.  On November 8, 2014, the ICA raised over $15,000 at the Holy Boulders Second Annual Climbing Competition, coined 'The Second Testament,' through various events such as the climbing competition, raffles, silent auctions, and an ICA-sponsored University fundraising challenge, through which the Climbing Club at the University of Illinois raised $3,000.  Over 200 competitors were present on site, nearly double that of last year's event.
Please join us next year for this incredible event to ensure the protection of these immaculate sandstone boulders!  Please donate at anytime by visiting:
www.accessfund.org/holyboulders
And support the local climbing organization, the ICA, by becoming a member at:
www.ilclimbers.org
Video and edit by Kevin Sierzega
Music:  'Howling at the Moon' by the Ramones

fields.author: Kevin Sierzega
fields.description:
Since the purchase of the Holy Boulders by the Access Fund in summer of 2012, the local climbing community has developed and revitalized a ton of problems at the site. Enjoy Part 2 of this video series that encompasses a bunch of new and/or revived problems, mostly in the easy to moderate grades, at this immaculate sandstone boulder field in beautiful southern Illinois!

Please follow the link below to donate and ensure the protection of the Holy Boulders for years to come:
accessfund.org/holyboulders

Music:  "New Cannonball Blues," TV on the Radio
"All in Forms," Bonobo

fields.name: The Third Annual Holy Boulders Competition hosted by the ICA
fields.author: Kevin Sierzega
fields.description:
In 2012, the private property that housed the Holy Boulders went up for sale. The Illinois Climbers Association immediately alerted the Access Fund and the property was shortly purchased with AFLCC funds. On November 7, 2015, the ICA raised $18,000 at the Holy Boulders Third Annual Climbing Competition. Again, over 200 competitors were present on site.

Please support the local climbing organization, the ICA, with their goal of long-term ownership of the Holy Boulders and their other projects in IL by becoming a member at:
http://ilclimbers.org

Please donate to the Holy Boulders at anytime by visiting:
ilclimbers.org/page8/index.html -or- accessfund.org/holyboulders

(Music: Spoon, "Inside Out")

fields.name: Prescribed Burn at the Holy Boulders
fields.author: Kevin Sierzega
fields.description:
The Illinois Climbers Association facilitated and sponsored a prescribed burn at the Holy Boulders property with the local SIUC Fire Dawgs in Spring 2015.  The burn was very successful and a first step towards ecological restoration of the site.

Prescribed fire on the landscape is a crucial management tool used to promote healthy forest ecosystems. Historically, southern Illinois upland forests, especially south and west facing slopes (as defines the Holy Boulders), burned at an interval of 3-5 years, until fire suppression in the early 20th century. Fire is necessary to promote ecologically valuable tree species (e.g. oak-hickory) and mitigate unexpected, high intensity fires by diminishing fuel loads. Furthermore, fire allows for more open and aesthetic forests, void of large amounts of downed debris.

Special thanks to Dr. Charles Ruffner and the SIUC Saluki Fire Dawgs.

The ICA is committed to best-management practices for Illinois' numerous climbing resources.  To find out more, please visit:
http://ilclimbers.org
and become a member of your local climbing organization!

Music:  "Logan's Loop" by Andrew Bird

fields.name: Save the Holy Boulders
fields.author: Rock Warrior Films
fields.description:
We stopped at the Holy Boulders in Southern Illinois and sampled the incredible sandstone the area offers.  One of the days we climbed on a ton of fun problems and tried to film as much as possible.
The Access Fund has purchased the area and is still in need of more donations to pay it off.  Help protect this unique bouldering area.  If you want to donate you can follow this link..  https://www.kintera.org/site/c.tmL5KhNWLrH/b.8371223/k.C7CB/Protect_Whats_Holy/apps/ka/sd/donor.asp?c=tmL5KhNWLrH&b=8371223&en=8hLFJRMvF7KOL1OyH6LLIXPIJrLSKUNGImIVI3MIKkIPL3PNKvE

Climbers featured: Matt Satermo, Erin Ayla, and myself
Problems featured: Tyler Durden (V5/7?), The Mollusk (V3), Odd Job (V8), Enlightenment (V4/5), Shadow of a Man (V5), KFC (V3), Big Meech (V8), Atlas (V4/5), Red Sea (V6)

Thanks to Evolv and Fixe Hardware for the support.
-Ian Cotter-Brown

fields.name: Regression
fields.author: Yolanda Chen
fields.description:
After months of pulling on plastic, we were in utter desperation to get outside and climb on some real rock. I went with "the boys" to do some bouldering at the Holy Boulders in Illinois. Aside from the less than optimal conditions, the overabundance of poison ivy, and the sheer disappointment at our obvious regression, we had a spectacular time. It was just nice to get outside, spend quality time with good friends and share a laugh or two - I hope you can appreciate that in the video. Enjoy. 

Equipment: Panasonic TS-1
Software: iMovie 09
Music: Thievery Corporation and Chumbawamba
